dialogue.DialogueString: In the distance Pygor hears a very loud man talking about ideals and the future or whatnot. Frowns could be seen on most people near him...
Pygor locks eyes with the man... He stares back. It sends a chill down his spine...
It seems that I have a job to take care of everyone! I will return on a second's notice!
Oh no... Why is he approaching...
Well hello sport, you seem a bit down on your luck. I have an enticing offer for you, if you're willing to lend your ear?
What? What are you talking about? Who are you?
Oh golly, well the name's Geneva if you weren't aware, and as you may have seen, some people don't really take kindly to the things I say when I'm doing my craft.
And lets just say I'd prefer it if I didn't die before I became president.
And what does this have to do wi-
Now you see that's where you come in buddy, my bodyguard has been a bit on the slacking side lately,
and my reputation has been a bit iffy as of late, which means I could really use another pair of helping hands, you see?
Are you sure I'm cut out for this?
Well look at you, you're a freaking house! I don't think any loon in their right mind wants to get on my case with you around!
How much is this gonna pay..?
Something we will negotiate on at a later notice! Now follow me!
Pygor follows as Min grasps him by the collar off his shirt, he pulls surprisingly hard considering his stature.
As he gets pulled into a dark alley, Pygor regrets the events that lead up to this point even more than before.
His worries are tenfold as they enter into...
What he guesses is Midbourghs dingiest bar.
This is home base buddy, whatcha think? Isn't the scenery and crowd not the best?
Despite the scenery, there are a good amount of people present.
Uh yea this is nice, I suppose...
HEY GRUG, GET YOUR LAZY BUM OVER HERE.
A man sits up from one of the booths.
Ughhh, yeayea, I'm up boss. What's up? Who's this guy?
Your new colleague of course!
'Grug' gives him a good lookover.
You replacin' me? Neat, I needed retirement anyway...
No you buffoon, you said we needed more manpower so I got more!
Oh yea, I did say that yesterday...
Wait, when did you find this guy?
2 minutes ago.
How did you find him?
He was looking at my rally.
And you were rallying while I wasn't there to stand guard?
Grungo Grungo Grungo, you're too lazy! If I had to stick to your schedule I'd never get my numbers up!
Mr. Geneva, please tell me how this job is gonna work and what I am getting out of this you have not told me anything.
Oh damnit Min, how have you not told the employee what the job is even about?
But I did... Oh no, is this one all brawn?
Wouldn't that be a good thing?
I'm not stupid, you just pulled me over here cause you said you needed a bodyguard, you didn't give me any more explanation than that...
Oh damn, I'm very sorry about that, Min gets a bit ahead of his case easily.
I prefer to call it being faster than everyone.
Let me do the negotiatin' here okay?
Ok
Okay so, the job's basically making it so Mr. President over here doesn't get beat up while he's holding a rally.
Considering your build, I assume you know how to punch someone.
H-How common are those altercations?
Common enough that we need another bodyguard.
And why exactly do people want to kill Mr. Geneva?
Min tells me every politician gets treated like this, he has it worse cause his ideas are a bit zany.
Zany, how?
A lot of stuff about the water, he wants to invest tax money into solutions but people do not seem to get it.
That's... actually way better than I thought it was gonna be, my town had a lot of problems with the water shortage.
You do? Where ya from bub?
Tumbletree.
Wait, you a druid?
Yes...
Aha, neat, very cool.
Oh gee, someone's a bit scared of magic.
I am for quite a good reason I'll have you know...
Just please watch out around me when using your ajimaji bullcrap.
That's just plain offensive...
How much would I be getting paid for this?
Wait, you're gonna pay this guy? Be happy kid, I don't even get that pleasure.
Shut up, freeloader.
You're the one that let's me do it.
Okay okay, now to get to the business. Let's make it a bit enticing for you...
I'll pay you double for the first week, double meaning double for what you'd need for food and a stay at the inn,
Which is better pay than any oddjob you'd find around here.
Can confirm, they pay scratches 'round here. No binding contracts either so you can up and quit anytime.
I see, well I guess I can't really refuse a good pay right now...
Well if that isn't just sublime! Let's get back out there, I told my crowd I'd be back in a jiff after all!
Yea that sounds like a plan, if something happens we'll tell you what to do rookie.
And just like that they walk out off the bar, Pygor does appreciate not being pulled like last time.
But he's all the more worried about what he's getting himself into.
